contentrichtext.text: {{no footnotes|date=December 2012}} {{Infobox military person |name = David Dragunsky |birth_date = 2 February 1910 |death_date = {{Death date and age|df=yes|1992|10|12|1910|2|2}} |birth_place = [[Bryansk Oblast]] |death_place = [[Moscow]]) |placeofburial= |image = DA Dragunskiy.jpg |caption = |nickname = |allegiance = {{USSR}} {{RUS}} |branch = |serviceyears = |rank = |commands = |unit = |battles = |awards = {{Hero of the Soviet Union}} {{Hero of the Soviet Union}} {{Order of Lenin}} (2) |relations = |laterwork = }} '''David Abramovich Dragunsky''' (Давид Абрамович Драгунский; 1910 [[Svyatsk]], [[Bryansk Oblast]] - 1992 [[Moscow]]) was born to a Jewish family and became a [[Colonel General]] in the [[Soviet Army]]. Twice he was decorated as a [[Hero of the Soviet Union]]. == Biography == In 1938, he commanded a tank company during combat operations near [[Battle of Khasan Lake|Khasan Lake]] and was awarded an [[Order of the Red Banner]]. During [[World War II]], he was in command of a tank battalion and, in 1943, he became the commander of the [[55th Guards Tank Brigade]] of the [[3rd Guards Tank Army (Soviet Union)|3rd Guards Tank Army]]. In 1983, he was designated chairman of [[Anti-Zionist committee of the Soviet public]] by the Ideological Department of the [[CPSU Central Committee]] and the [[KGB]]. == Publications == *''A Soldier's Memoirs'' ==References== {{reflist}} *[http://www.warheroes.ru/hero/hero.asp?Hero_id=1050 His biography (in Russian)] * William Korey, ''Russian Antisemitism, Pamyat and Demonology of Zionism,'' Harwood Academic Publishers, 1995 {{Authority control|VIAF=74644138}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Dragunsky, David | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = 1910 | PLACE OF BIRTH = [[Bryansk Oblast]] | DATE OF DEATH = 1992 | PLACE OF DEATH = [[Moscow]]) }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Dragunsky, David}} [[Category:1910 births]] [[Category:1992 deaths]] [[Category:People from Bryansk Oblast]] [[Category:Russian Jews]] [[Category:Heroes of the Soviet Union]] [[Category:Double Heroes of the Soviet Union]] [[Category:Recipients of the Order of the Red Banner]] [[Category:Jewish anti-Zionism]] [[Category:Jewish atheists]] [[Category:Soviet Jews in the military]] [[Category:Soviet generals]] [[Category:Soviet military personnel of World War II]] [[Category:Tank commanders]] {{Russia-mil-bio-stub}} {{Russia-politician-stub}}
